intro: Adriana hookeri var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smoothleaf adriana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are generally smooth and narrow, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
